column4: passwords are bad. If you really want to go for security, get a seagate harddrive that supports hardware encryption and use 2FA or SA, preferably on an external token
do you want to give a benchmark of FDE impact?

software-based FDE will give you around a 30% performance hit on most modern machines, most software will allow you to hit 40gig/hour on the initial encryption. That's why I recommend hardware based encryption, the harddrive takes care of that.
